medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had a 2-year history of multiple cavitary lung lesions, primarily in the left upper lobe. Six months prior to the current presentation, she experienced new onset of hemoptysis and worsening of abscesses on the thigh, along with painful nodules on the elbow, right breast, and abdomen. Symptoms progressed without fever, night sweats, or weight loss, but with joint and back pains.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of multiple cavitary lung lesions treated for presumptive cryptococcosis with fluconazole for 18 months and infertility for 3 years due to narrowing of tubes found on hysterosalpingography.
medical_history.social_history: Lived in the United States for 7 years without significant outdoor exposure apart from brief walks in the park while veiled. No history of digging in the soil.
